cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 160 mi S of Panama City FL and 140 mi SSW of Apalachicola FL
cyclone.trajectory: moving northward across the northeastern Gulf, forecast to make landfall in the western Florida Panhandle this afternoon/evening, then weaken while tracking north-northeast through Alabama–Georgia and the southern Appalachians toward the Mid-Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: western Florida Panhandle (near Panama City-Apalachicola area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch/Warning area extends Navarre FL eastward to the Wakulla/Jefferson County line
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning Indian Pass FL to Yankeetown FL; Tropical Storm Warning Navarre FL to Wakulla/Jefferson County line
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Panhandle and Big Bend, then inland through AL/GA and the southern Appalachians; eventual rain impacts Mid-Atlantic coast
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (isolated 4–6 inch amounts cited for Mid-Atlantic)
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible (gusts 25–35 mph) as remnant low passes inland to the west of the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Delaware coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with isolated higher totals could trigger localized flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado risk cannot be ruled out inland; potential river/urban flooding impacts port operations
